title: How to Apply Natural Makeup for School

steps.title: Apply a lightweight foundation.
steps.content: Apply a lightweight foundation . To even out your skin and cover mild discolorations, take a little liquid foundation and blend it in with your fingertips or a makeup sponge. [1] X Research source For the most natural look, use a sheer, buildable foundation and apply it in thin layers until you get the coverage you want. [2] X Research source Make sure to use a foundation that matches your skin tone. [3] X Expert Source Alicia D'Angelo Makeup Artist & Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 April 2020. You can check the tone by applying a little to your jawline. Additionally, pick a foundation that works with your skin type. For example, if you have oily or breakout-prone skin, go for a foundation that’s oil-free and non-comedogenic (won’t clog your pores). [4] X Expert Source Alicia D'Angelo Makeup Artist & Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 April 2020.

steps.title: Use a little concealer to cover up blemishes and discolorations.
steps.content: Use a little concealer to cover up blemishes and discolorations. If you have any spots or blotches that the foundation doesn’t cover, apply a little concealer and blend it in. You can also swipe some concealer under your eyes to cover up dark circles. [5] X Research source When blending in concealer under your eyes, gently dab it with your fingers instead of rubbing. Rubbing can irritate your delicate under-eye skin.

steps.title: Brush on some powder
steps.content: Brush on some powder if your skin gets oily. If you have oily skin, applying a little translucent powder can help keep it under control and reduce shine throughout the day. [6] X Expert Source Alicia D'Angelo Makeup Artist & Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 April 2020. Load some powder into a makeup brush, tap it to remove the excess, and sweep it all over your face. [7] X Research source Focus on the T-zone (the middle of your forehead, your nose, and your chin), since this area tends to get especially oily throughout the day.

steps.title: Add color to your cheeks with a warm, subtle blush.
steps.content: Add color to your cheeks with a warm, subtle blush . To bring a soft glow to your cheeks, apply a little blush along your cheekbones. Choose a warm pink or peach rather than a cool pink for a more natural look. [9] X Research source Cream blushes will give your cheeks a more dewy, natural appearance than powder blushes. [10] X Research source To apply a cream blush , use your fingers to gently dab a little color onto the fullest parts of your cheeks, blending it in until it looks like you're blushing naturally. If you prefer powder blushes, use a brush to gently swirl the color onto the fullest parts of your cheeks.

steps.title: Put on a subtle highlighter to help define your face.
steps.content: Put on a subtle highlighter to help define your face. You can also use a highlighter to define areas like the tops of your cheekbones, your forehead, and your nose. Use a brush to gently sweep the highlighter over the areas you’d like to bring out. You can also lightly tap it on with your fingertips. [11] X Research source Avoid using highlighters that are too glittery or shimmery. While these can give you a gorgeous, fairytale glow, it’s not the most natural look!

steps.title: Brush your eyebrows, then fill them in with powder.
steps.content: Brush your eyebrows, then fill them in with powder. To get tidy-looking eyebrows that don’t look overdone, lightly groom them with an eyebrow brush. If you like, you can then fill them in very lightly with an eyebrow powder that matches your natural brow color. [12] X Expert Source Alicia D'Angelo Makeup Artist & Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 April 2020. [13] X Research source Avoid using an eyebrow pencil, since this can make your eyebrows look too obviously defined and made-up.

steps.title: Dust your lids with a neutral brown eyeshadow.
steps.content: Dust your lids with a neutral brown eyeshadow . To bring out your eyelids, choose a brownish eyeshadow that’s only 1-2 shades darker than your natural skin color. Brush the shadow over your eyelids and along the crease below your brow bone. Blend it in carefully to create a smooth transition between the shadow and your natural skin tone. [14] X Research source If you like, you can also add a little subtle highlighter or eye brightener to the inner corners of your eyes and your brow bones.

steps.title: Add a thin line of black eyeshadow to your upper lash line.
steps.content: Add a thin line of black eyeshadow to your upper lash line. To subtly darken the base of your lashes, use a fine, angled brush to apply a little bit of black eyeshadow just along your upper lash line. [15] X Research source For an even subtler look, skip the shadow. Take a dark brown or grey eyeliner pencil and lightly dot it along your upper lash line instead. [16] X Research source Don’t go beyond the edges of your lash line, and keep the line thin—otherwise, you will end up with a more dramatic, less natural look. You can also subtly widen your eyes by adding a little nude liner to your lower waterline.

steps.title: Define your lashes with a curler and a hint of mascara.
steps.content: Define your lashes with a curler and a hint of mascara . Use a curler to widen your eyes and give your lashes a more dramatic look. Then, sweep some mascara onto your upper lashes to darken and define them. Go for light, non-clumping formula for a more natural appearance. [17] X Research source Don’t put any mascara on your lower lash line, since this will make your eyes look more obviously made-up. Choose a mascara that is not dramatically darker than your natural lashes. For example, if your lashes are blond, go with a brown mascara. For darker lashes, opt for brownish-black. [18] X Research source If you don’t have an eyelash curler, you can curl your lashes with a spoon, a cotton swab, or your fingers.

steps.title: Brighten your lips with a tinted balm or a sheer, nude lipstick.
steps.content: Brighten your lips with a tinted balm or a sheer, nude lipstick. To add a finishing touch to your look, swipe on a little tinted balm in a color that matches your natural lips. Make it look more natural by dabbing it on with your fingers instead of applying from the tube. Start at the center of your lips and blend out to the edges. [19] X Research source For a slightly bolder look, use a nude lipstick instead. [20] X Research source You can also use a colorless balm to give your lips a natural softness and shine without adding any tint.
